summary: This document is an email chain from May 2025 discussing an individual (name redacted) who believes he is being stalked and is concerned about two people he hired, theorizing they may be connected to the Epstein investigation. The individual's attorney, John Diaz, reaches out to an unknown recipient, and the matter is discussed among other parties regarding how to respond.

persons.name: John Diaz
persons.context: Attorney who sent an initial email on behalf of his client, reporting the client's concerns about being stalked and his suspicion that hired individuals are connected to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: John Diaz is acting as legal counsel for the redacted individual, communicating the client's concerns to others.

events.title: Attorney reports client's stalking concerns
events.description: Attorney John Diaz emails an unknown recipient to report that his client believes he is being stalked and is concerned about two people he hired, theorizing a connection to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Internal discussion on response
events.description: Email discussion among parties about how to respond to the attorney, noting the client did not articulate a stalking situation or observe any crimes related to the investigation.

keyFacts: An individual (name redacted) believes he is being stalked and is concerned about two people he hired, theorizing they are connected to the Epstein investigation.
The individual's attorney, John Diaz, reached out to report these concerns, though the client had not observed any crimes or mentioned the investigation directly.
Internal email discussion indicates the client did not articulate a clear stalking situation and was advised to report concerns to local law enforcement.
The correspondence shows ongoing speculation and concern in 2025 about connections to the Epstein investigation, years after the main events.
